title: How to Make Spiral Wire Tree Decorations

steps.headline: Assemble the items needed.
steps.description: These are listed below under "Things You'll Need"

steps.headline: Position the foam cone on a flat surface, such as a table top.
Starting from the top, wrap the armature wire down the foam cone, until you reach the bottom.
steps.description: Cut off any excess wire. Armature wire holds its shape well, so you shouldn't have to apply too much pressure.

steps.headline: Pull the foam out from under the wire sculpture.
steps.description: Using the pliers, fold over the top of the armature wire to make a loop for hanging the decoration from. Cut any excess wire off.

steps.headline: Thread thin cord through the loop.
steps.description: You might also need to thread it through the top of the tree sculpture to create stability - test it when hanging. Tie the cord together to form a loop.

steps.headline: Hang on the tree as a decoration.
steps.description: Proceed to make as many more as wished.

text: Assemble the items needed. These are listed below under "Things You'll Need" Position the foam cone on a flat surface, such as a table top.  Starting from the top, wrap the armature wire down the foam cone, until you reach the bottom. Cut off any excess wire. Armature wire holds its shape well, so you shouldn't have to apply too much pressure. Pull the foam out from under the wire sculpture. Using the pliers, fold over the top of the armature wire to make a loop for hanging the decoration from. Cut any excess wire off. Thread thin cord through the loop. You might also need to thread it through the top of the tree sculpture to create stability - test it when hanging. Tie the cord together to form a loop. Hang on the tree as a decoration. Proceed to make as many more as wished.
